question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable for display. Create a comprehensive data dashboard for innovative elderly care models in Shaanxi Province, including visualization design and detailed data presentation. Output should be in HTML format to ensure executability.

checklist.title: Is the elderly care data dashboard structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements a complete dashboard structure with proper HTML5 semantic layout (header, main content areas, sidebar, footer) and responsive design. Check if CSS Grid/Flexbox is used for layout management and if the dashboard includes necessary navigation components. Score 0 if the basic structure is missing, 5 if only basic layout is implemented without semantic HTML, and 10 if a complete, semantic, and responsive dashboard framework is implemented.

checklist.title: Are the data visualization components properly implemented?
checklist.description: Verify implementation of essential charts for elderly care data (demographic trends, service distribution, facility locations, etc.) using appropriate visualization libraries (D3.js, Chart.js, ECharts, etc.). Charts should include proper axes, legends, tooltips, and interactive elements. Deduct 3 points if charts lack proper legends/tooltips, 5 points if visualizations are static without interactivity, and 5 points if inappropriate chart types are chosen for the data. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is Shaanxi-specific geographical data visualization implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the dashboard includes a map visualization of Shaanxi Province with accurate regional boundaries, showing elderly care facility distribution, coverage areas, or regional statistics. Verify if the map is interactive (zoom, pan, click for details) and uses appropriate geographical encoding (colors, symbols). Deduct 5 points if the map is static, 3 points if it lacks proper legends, and 5 points if geographical data is inaccurate. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the elderly care innovation model comparison feature implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the dashboard provides visual comparisons between traditional and innovative elderly care models in Shaanxi (e.g., service efficiency, cost analysis, satisfaction rates, health outcomes). Check for implementation of comparative charts, before/after views, or innovation impact metrics. Deduct 5 points if comparison metrics are missing, 3 points if data lacks context explanations, and 5 points if innovative models aren't clearly distinguished. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data, browser compatibility issues, screen size variations, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-driven insights and predictions 2. Elderly user persona profiles 3. Time-series animation of demographic changes 4. Voice-controlled dashboard navigation for accessibility). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar visualizations (e.g., multiple charts showing the same data differently) 2. Feature modules unrelated to elderly care in Shaanxi (e.g., irrelevant statistics from other regions) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary 3D effects or animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/visualization/UI components), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global variable pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no data loading error handling. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the dashboard design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching suitable for elderly care theme (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Data filter/selection feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Chart transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance for elderly care insights. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual stuttering during interactions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
